viruses.name: WannaCry
viruses.description: Ransomware that exploited a Windows SMB vulnerability, causing global chaos in 2017

characteristics.behavior: Attacks indiscriminately any vulnerable system. Prioritizes rapid, massive spread over caution. Doesn't care about being detected - speed is everything.

viruses.name: Stuxnet
viruses.description: Extremely sophisticated worm developed to sabotage Iran's nuclear program

characteristics.behavior: Extremely selective and patient. Completely ignores non-critical targets. Hides for long periods and uses multiple evasion techniques. Attacks only when it finds the perfect target (specific industrial systems).

viruses.name: Mirai
viruses.description: Massive botnet that infected millions of IoT devices using default passwords

characteristics.behavior: Massive brute-force attack. Tries default passwords on any device it finds. Extremely high volume of simultaneous attempts. Doesn't care about sophisticated defenses - it only seeks weak, unprotected targets.

viruses.name: Conficker
viruses.description: Polymorphic worm that infected millions of computers, creating a resilient botnet

characteristics.behavior: Highly adaptable. Uses multiple attack vectors simultaneously. Constantly mutates to avoid detection and removal. Balances speed with discretion - not the fastest nor the stealthiest, but the hardest to eradicate.

viruses.exploit: MS08-067 + USB drives + network shares + weak passwords

viruses.name: NotPetya
viruses.description: Destructive malware disguised as ransomware, causing billions in damage

characteristics.behavior: Aggressive and destructive. Focuses on corporate networks. Uses stolen credentials to propagate laterally. Prioritizes maximum damage over persistence - infects quickly and permanently destroys data.

viruses.name: Agent.BTZ
viruses.description: Worm that infected classified military networks via USB drives

characteristics.behavior: Patient and persistent. Specialized in crossing air-gaps (systems isolated from the internet). Propagates slowly via physical media. Avoids detection at all costs - can remain dormant for months. Collects information discreetly before moving.

viruses.name: ILOVEYOU
viruses.description: Love letter email worm that infected 10% of internet-connected computers in 2000

characteristics.behavior: Explosive social engineering. Sends itself to all contacts in Outlook address book. Overwrites standard files (images, audio) with copies of itself. Relies on human curiosity rather than software exploits.

viruses.name: Zeus
viruses.description: The king of banking trojans, stealing credentials and forming a massive botnet

characteristics.behavior: Silent thief. Injects code into banking websites to steal credentials. Forms a peer-to-peer botnet for resilience. Focuses on remaining undetected to maximize financial theft over time.

viruses.name: Emotet
viruses.description: Polymorphic malware often serving as a distributor for other threats like ransomware

characteristics.behavior: The gateway drug of malware. Changes its code every time it's downloaded (polymorphic). Establishes a foothold and then sells access to other criminals (Ransomware-as-a-Service model).

viruses.name: Code Red
viruses.description: Server-side worm that attacked Microsoft IIS web servers, defacing sites

characteristics.behavior: Memory-resident predator. Unlike others, it lives only in memory, leaving no trace on the hard drive. Scans for random IP addresses to infect. Launches DDoS attacks on promised dates.

viruses.exploit: Buffer Overflow in IIS Indexing Service

viruses.name: Storm Worm
viruses.description: One of the first peer-to-peer botnets, massive and resilient

characteristics.behavior: Decentralized swarm. Uses P2P architecture making it incredibly hard to take down. If defenders attack the servers, the bots retaliate with DDoS (defensive behavior).

viruses.name: DarkSide
viruses.description: Modern RaaS responsible for the Colonial Pipeline shutdown

characteristics.behavior: Professional corporate extortion. Analysis of victim financials before setting ransom price. Steals data for 'double extortion' (pay to decrypt + pay to prevent leak). Avoids systems in specific languages/regions.
